PAD_AftermathAvatarStealthDrain.synopsis: Character wakes up in the morning after a terrible night's sleep. They're weak, woozy, and aching. They don't realise that Astarion secretly drank their blood last night and they slept through the whole thing.

SCO_Companion_AstarionSneaksOff.synopsis: Every party member sleeps around the campfire, but Astarion is seen sneaking off by the viewer

PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft.synopsis: PAD when the player wakes up to find one of the party has disappeared during the night. Astarion knows what happened - they discovered that he's a vampire and left - but doesn't want to share that information.

SCO_Companion.synopsis: You wake up and find Astarion hunching over you, fangs bared. You fight him off. Caught off guard, he's alarmed and worried that you're going to kill him. He tries to be charming, explaining that he's too weak without blood. If you push back against his excuses he gets frustrated - he tries to bargain with you. If you agree to let him bite you, he's thrilled. He feels in control again. After drinking, he feels invigorated and cocky.
SCO_Companion.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. add Astarion to your party4. oe qnight NIGHT_AstarionHungerC_Bite_fe3fd3a0-70d1-4bc4-8a7f-4614f89ac23d5. go to camp and take a long rest

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.synopsis: Astarion wakes up from a terrifying dream of his old master. His master had forbidden him to drink humanoid blood, but his master wasn't there... Astarion looks at the sleeping companions and considers biting one of them. If he does, he rolls a stealth check. If he succeeds, he sucks their blood (he can stop or decide to drain them dry). If he fails they wake up, and have to be convinced not to leave him.

PAD_AftermathAvatarKilled.synopsis: PAD when you wake up to find one of your party limp in their bedroll. They've been murdered in their sleep, blood visible on their throat. (Astarion killed them, although the party won't know that.)

PAD_AftermathAvatarStealthDrain_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AftermathAvatarStealthDrain_0.text: Ugh. I don't know what I slept on, but my neck's killing me.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_10.speaker: Cazador Szarr
SCO_Avatar_Dream_10.text: First, thou shalt not drink of the blood of thinking creatures.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_7.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_Dream_7.text: Master? I was just coming to see you!

SCO_Avatar_Dream_15.speaker: Cazador Szarr
SCO_Avatar_Dream_15.text: Second, thou shalt obey me in all things.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_14.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_Dream_14.text: Absolutely. It's just that I was kidnapped by a tentacle-faced -

SCO_Avatar_Dream_17.speaker: Cazador Szarr
SCO_Avatar_Dream_17.text: Third, thou shalt not leave my side unless directed.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_0.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Avatar_Dream_0.text: *You can feel the old fear turning in your gut, but you force yourself to keep smiling. As you so often did before.*

SCO_Avatar_Dream_19.speaker: Cazador Szarr
SCO_Avatar_Dream_19.text: Fourth, thou shalt know that thou art mine.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_11.speaker: Cazador Szarr
SCO_Avatar_Dream_11.text: Free? Lie to yourself, boy, but not to me.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_8.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Avatar_Dream_8.text: Please, you have to forgive me.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_2.speaker: Cazador Szarr
SCO_Avatar_Dream_2.text: Pathetic. As always. But at least you know your place.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_20.speaker: Cazador Szarr
SCO_Avatar_Dream_20.text: Do not forget who made you. Do not forget who carved those scars into your back.

SCO_Avatar_Dream_18.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Avatar_Dream_18.text: *Your heart pounds, but you're ready. He's going to regret coming for you.*

SCO_Avatar_Dream_13.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Avatar_Dream_13.text: *You keep low to the ground, scuttling like a rat.*

PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_6.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_6.text: She rushed off this morning. Probably some infernal business.

PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_9.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_9.text: I wouldn't worry. We're better off without her.

PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_14.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_14.text: Oh, she probably wandered off to kill something adorable.

PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_13.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_13.text: She rushed off this morning. Wouldn't say why.

PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_7.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_7.text: Rushed off this morning. He probably remembered an overdue book.

PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_2.speaker: Astarion
PAD_AftermathAvatarCompanionLeft_2.text: I wouldn't worry. We're better off without him.

SCO_Companion_34.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_34.text: *You don't sleep well, flitting between dreams and nightmares.*

SCO_Companion_145.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_145.text: *Maybe you wake up because you know something is wrong. Or maybe you just get lucky.*

SCO_Companion_61.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is hunched over your bedrool, fangs baredNodeContext: Hunched over the player's bedroll, about to bite someone, but they've just woken up and are looking up at you. More deadpan than urgent.

SCO_Companion_26.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_26.text: No no - it's not what it looks like, I swear!
SCO_Companion_26.context: NodeContext: Standing up from hunched position, stepping back

SCO_Companion_130.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_130.text: I wasn't going to hurt you! I just needed - well, blood.

SCO_Companion_5.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_5.text: *There, in dim firelight, you see him for what he really is: a vampire. A slave to sanguine hunger.*

SCO_Companion_9.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_9.text: You were strangely concerned when we met the monster hunter in the swamp.

SCO_Companion_19.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_19.text: It's not what you think - I'm not some monster!

SCO_Companion_49.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_49.text: I feed on animals! Boars, deer, kobolds - whatever I can get.

SCO_Companion_42.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_42.text: I'm just too slow right now. Too weak.

SCO_Companion_119.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_119.text: If I just had a little blood, I could think clearer. Fight better. Please.

SCO_Companion_55.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_55.text: *A strange sensation courses through you, and your companion's mind unfolds, secrets half-revealed.*

SCO_Companion_173.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_173.text: At best, I was sure you'd say no. More likely, you'd ram a stake through my ribs.

SCO_Companion_116.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_116.text: No, I needed you to trust me. And you can trust me.

SCO_Companion_160.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_160.text: Thank you. Do you think you could trust me just a little further?
SCO_Companion_160.context: NodeContext: You know you're pushing your luck a little

SCO_Companion_38.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_38.text: I only need a taste, I swear.
SCO_Companion_38.context: NodeContext: He cups your cheek in his hand

SCO_Companion_136.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_136.text: Fine. But not a drop more than you need.

SCO_Companion_161.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_161.text: Really? I - of course. Not one drop more.

SCO_Companion_87.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_87.text: All right, but go too far and I'll drive a stake through your chest.

SCO_Companion_13.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_13.text: Ah. Of course. I shall be gentle as a babe.
SCO_Companion_13.context: NodeContext: Nervous. They have a stake against your heart.

SCO_Companion_32.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_32.text: Let's make ourselves comfortable, shall we?
SCO_Companion_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion gestures, inviting the player to lie down on the bedroll at his feet.NodeContext: Astarion gestures, inviting the player to lie down on the bedroll at his feet.

SCO_Companion_139.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_139.text: *It's like a shard of ice into your neck - a quick, sharp pain that fades to throbbing numbness. Your breath catches, your pulse quickens.*

SCO_Companion_164.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_164.context: NodeContext: While biting the player's neck - you realise they've asked you to stop. You oblige and step away

SCO_Companion_27.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_27.context: NodeContext: You were biting their neck, but the player pushes you back. 'ah' = surprise at being pushed.

SCO_Companion_56.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_56.text: My mind is finally clear. I feel strong. I feel... happy!

SCO_Companion_169.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_169.text: Don't be so dramatic. This is just a little transaction between friends.

SCO_Companion_93.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_93.text: *You try to push him back, but his grip just gets tighter. You can feel your blood racing, coursing through both your bodies.*

SCO_Companion_134.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_134.context: NodeContext: Was biting the player's neck. You break the contact and say the line.

SCO_Companion_73.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_73.text: I was just swept up in the moment.

SCO_Companion_29.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_29.text: But it worked. I feel good. Strong. Happy!

SCO_Companion_125.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_125.text: But I didn't. And that's what matters.

SCO_Companion_162.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_162.text: And look what you've gained. Together, we can take on the world.

SCO_Companion_70.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_70.text: I hope so. I look forward to seeing you fight.

SCO_Companion_28.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_28.text: You need to leave my camp. Now.

SCO_Companion_144.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_144.text: You'd toss me aside over this?

SCO_Companion_172.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_172.text: Fine. See how far you get without me.
SCO_Companion_172.context: NodeContext: Turns and walks away in a bitter rage.

SCO_Companion_44.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_44.text: If you ever try that again, I'll cut you in half.

SCO_Companion_22.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_22.text: It won't happen again, you have my word.

SCO_Companion_86.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_86.text: I'm looking forward to seeing you fight.

SCO_Companion_114.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_114.text: Shouldn't take long. So many people need killing.

SCO_Companion_0.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_0.text: Now, if you'll excuse me, you're invigorating, but I need something more filling.

SCO_Companion_146.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_146.text: This is a gift, you know. I won't forget it.
SCO_Companion_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Called over his shoulder as he walks awayNodeContext: Called over his shoulder as he walks away

SCO_Companion_189.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_189.text: *You watch as he stalks towards the forest. Stronger. More confident. Ready to hunt.*

SCO_Companion_180.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_180.text: *You watch as he stalks off. Stronger. More confident. Ready to hunt.*

SCO_Companion_66.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_66.text: His guard's down - grab the stake and drive it into his heart.

SCO_Companion_97.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion staked in the heartNodeContext: The player has just lunged forward and staked you in the heart. You're going to say 'you killed me'

SCO_Companion_135.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_135.context: NodeContext: Astarion had been leaning over a prone player, drinking their blood, but they just tried to stab him in the chest. He jumps back, furious.

SCO_Companion_108.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_108.text: *You can hear how weak your voice is. So can he, but he doesn't care. He's long past caring.*

SCO_Companion_150.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_150.text: *You feel a little cold, but that's all. There's no more pain, no more fear, no more struggle. It's all over...*

SCO_Companion_192.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_192.text: Grab the stake and drive it into his heart.

SCO_Companion_159.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion staked in the heartNodeContext: You've just been staked in the heart while biting the player. You break off the bite, look at the stake in disbelief. You're going to say 'you killed me'

SCO_Companion_1.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_1.text: *He doesn't finish the thought. It slides away as the light fades from his eyes.*

SCO_Companion_186.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_186.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player stakes Astarion in the chest, breaking off the bite
Astarion had been leaning over a prone player, drinking their blood, but they just tried to stab him in the chest. He jumps back, furious.

NodeContext: You've been stabbed, but they missed your heart, so feel free to throw in a grunt of pain

SCO_Companion_115.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_115.text: *You lean into him, losing yourself. You can feel your blood racing, coursing through both your bodies. A gentle, numb feeling starts to spread.*

SCO_Companion_197.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_197.text: Fine. But not a drop more than you need.

SCO_Companion_151.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_151.text: All right, but go too far and I'll drive a stake through your chest.

SCO_Companion_138.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_138.text: Urgh! Gods! Another drop and I would've burnt a hole from lips to navel. I thought we had that fire under control?
SCO_Companion_138.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls back, reacting to the heat of Karlach's blood.

SCO_Companion_199.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_199.text: Must be the infernal engine. Sorry, Astarion, I can't help you.

SCO_Companion_149.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_149.text: Guess my blood just isn't for drinking.

SCO_Companion_54.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_54.text: Have another taste, see what happens.

SCO_Companion_52.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_52.context: NodeContext: Not actually grateful; he doesn't want to bite her again, he'd die.

SCO_Companion_71.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_71.text: I'd offer to help, Astarion, but my engine still means I'm too hot to touch.

SCO_Companion_75.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_75.text: Gods! I'd nearly forgotten. I'm so hungry I would've bitten into anything.

SCO_Companion_105.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_105.text: Go ahead, if you want to burn your lips off.

SCO_Companion_78.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_78.text: Gods! I'd forgotten about your little affliction. Hunger does cloud your senses.

SCO_Companion_163.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_163.text: Go ahead. But be warned - you might bite off more than you can drink.

SCO_Companion_133.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_133.text: Really? Well, let's see, shall we?

SCO_Companion_131.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_131.text: *He moves in quickly, eagerly, and his bite is like a shard of ice through your neck.*

SCO_Companion_109.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_109.text: *But something inside you stirs, and the cold fades.*
SCO_Companion_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion realises something's wrong - the blood tastes foul, like drinking vinegar

SCO_Companion_64.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_64.text: Urgh! You taste like bile. What in the hells is wrong with you?
SCO_Companion_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls back, spitting out bloodNodeContext: You were biting his neck, but you break contact, spitting out blood in disgust

SCO_Companion_123.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_123.text: Think of it as a warning. I am not for eating.

SCO_Companion_200.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_200.text: You have your secrets, I have mine.

SCO_Companion_24.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_24.text: My body's the vessel for an orb of corrupt Netherese magic, remember? Not for the faint of heart.

SCO_Companion_53.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_53.text: Safe to say this will never happen again.

SCO_Companion_147.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_147.text: That's a long story involving the goddess of magic herself. Not one I'm inclined to tell to the man who just tried to bite me.

SCO_Companion_46.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_46.text: No. No, of course, silly of me to even ask.

SCO_Companion_102.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_102.text: I'll go and find something on four legs to eat, I suppose.

SCO_Companion_191.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_191.text: *You watch him stalk away, slumped, sulking, and ready to kill.*

SCO_Companion_88.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_88.text: He's too dangerous. Grab the stake and drive it into his heart.

SCO_Companion_59.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_59.text: You tried to bite me. How can I trust you?

SCO_Companion_183.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_183.text: Because we don't have a choice! Not if we're going to save ourselves from these worms.

SCO_Companion_137.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_137.text: I need you alive. You need me strong.

SCO_Companion_77.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_77.text: Please. Only be a taste, I swear. I'll be well, you'll be fine, and everything can go back to normal.

SCO_Companion_106.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_106.text: Leave. If I ever see you again, I'll kill you.

SCO_Companion_181.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_181.text: I don't care how much you need - you're not drinking my blood.

SCO_Companion_36.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_36.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

SCO_Companion_7.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_7.context: NodeContext: Calmly. Someone's searching your mind, but you feel very relaxed about it.

SCO_Companion_175.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_175.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

SCO_Companion_35.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_35.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

SCO_Companion_31.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_31.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

SCO_Companion_10.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_10.text: *His mind opens up, revealing cracked and quivering memories. At their heart, you see dark eyes, commanding you to feed.*

SCO_Companion_4.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_4.text: *You open your mouth and bite down. Not into a tender neck, but into the twisting body of a rat - the only thing your master lets you eat.*

SCO_Companion_2.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_2.text: You ate animals because you were forced to. Not because you wanted to.

SCO_Companion_196.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_196.text: I - yes. Yes, I ate whatever disgusting vermin my master picked. So you can see why I'm slow to trust you.

SCO_Companion_111.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_111.text: But I do trust you. And you can trust me.

SCO_Companion_198.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_198.text: Why didn't you tell me you were a vampire?

SCO_Companion_30.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_30.text: Grab the stake and attack, trying to drive it into his heart.

SCO_Companion_166.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_166.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

SCO_Companion_182.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_182.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

SCO_Companion_60.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_60.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

SCO_Companion_79.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_79.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

SCO_Companion_98.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_98.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

SCO_Companion_113.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_113.text: *You feel yourself repulsed as the doors of his mind slam shut.*

SCO_Companion_120.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_120.text: This is not the time to start invading each other's minds.

SCO_Companion_40.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_40.text: I wouldn't if you'd been honest with me. Why didn't you tell me?

SCO_Companion_18.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_18.text: It's not the time to drink each other's blood either.

SCO_Companion_45.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_45.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

SCO_Companion_176.speaker: Narrator
SCO_Companion_176.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

SCO_Companion_95.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_95.text: Push into his mind, searching for the truth.

SCO_Companion_90.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_90.text: So that's why you were so quick to kill the Gur hunter: to keep your secret.

SCO_Companion_122.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_122.text: That hunter in the swamp was right - you're a vampire spawn.

SCO_Companion_41.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_41.text: I can't believe I didn't see it - we even found the boar you snacked on.

SCO_Companion_25.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_25.text: How long since you killed someone? Days? Hours?

SCO_Companion_69.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_69.text: I've never killed anyone! Well, not for food.
SCO_Companion_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player picks up a stick and snaps it in two, creating a stake to threaten Astarion with.

SCO_Companion_103.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_103.text: I feed on animals. Boars, deer, kobolds - whatever I can get.

SCO_Companion_154.speaker: Astarion
SCO_Companion_154.text: But it's not enough. Not if I have to fight. I feel so weak.

SCO_Companion_190.speaker: Player
SCO_Companion_190.text: Pick up a stake and lunge at the monster.

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_54.speaker: Narrator
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_54.text: *Cazador. Your Master. You have to get back to him quickly. If you're late, he'll flay you. Again.*
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wake up, trying to breathe, afraid

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_64.speaker: Narrator
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_64.text: *What will he say when he finds you can walk in the sunlight and he can't?*

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_59.speaker: Narrator
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_59.text: *And then it dawns on you: if you're free to walk in daylight, can you be free of Cazador too?*

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_46.speaker: Astarion
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_46.text: 'First, thou shalt not drink of the blood of thinking creatures.'

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_23.speaker: Narrator
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_23.text: *You look at your companions. Sleeping. Helpless. How badly do you need to know?*

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_91.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Astarion creeps up to his target, looming over them, fangs bared

 DIR: This sets the player staging.

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_32.speaker: Narrator
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_32.text: *You can smell the sweetness of his skin - hear the beat of his pulse...*
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: DIR: There cannot be any transform data in this node

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_129.speaker: Astarion
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_129.text: Bite down, careful not to disturb them.

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_166.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion caresses the head of his victim and then bites - DIR: Ends in a continuous animation

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_160.speaker: Player
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: DIR: Acts as transition to align with staging of failure branch.NodeContext: You've been bitten - a vampire is draining your blood/essence

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_167.speaker: Player
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_167.context: CinematicNodeContext: DIR: Acts as transition to align with staging of failure branch.NodeContext: You've been bitten - a vampire is draining your blood/essence

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_175.speaker: Player
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: DIR: Acts as transition to align with staging of failure branch.NodeContext: You've been bitten - a vampire is draining your blood/essence

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_41.speaker: Narrator
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_41.text: *Blood gushes into your mouth. You can feel it filling the maw inside you - filling your soul.*
IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Should contain NO transform data or animation blocks

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_60.speaker: Player

IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice_123.speaker: Player
